title: Australian:Australian Football Club Had To Wear Training Kits For The Game After Airline Lost Their Luggage
text:
Australian Football Club Had To Wear Training Kits For The Game After Airline Lost Their Luggage

Australian Football Club Had To Wear Training Kits For The Game After Airline Lost Their Luggage

Well, it has happened with plenty of us. It might sound farcical, but it keeps on giving. Australian Football League Side Perth Glory had to play in their training kits after airline lost their luggage.

@PerthGlory

It coudn't have gone more worse before the A-league game between Western United and Perth Glory. After arriving in Melbourne for their league game, Perth Glory soon found out something very essential for the game was missing- their match jerseys.

The team's twitter handle made the announcement and the team was forced to wear their training kits.

Kit Switch...

Due to Qantas losing our regular kit in transit ☹️, here’s what we’ll be lining up in against @wufcofficial this afternoon...@ALeague #OneGlory #ALeague #WUNvPER pic.twitter.com/ahoL8h33w2 — Perth Glory FC (@PerthGloryFC) October 19, 2019

Making an announcement via Twitter a few hours before kick-off, Glory confirmed that their kits had in fact been misplaced by airline Qantas, and had gone missing at some point during the three-hour flight. Don't Miss 1.7 K SHARES 1.4 K SHARES 910 SHARES 2 K SHARES
